sen.e: Ningai, the founder of the Ono Lineage of Tomitsu, established Mandala-ji Temple at Ono, Yamashina and founded the base for Mikkyo practice. Kancho, younger than Yakushin, who received the kanjo from the Emperor Uda at Omuro-Ninnaji temple, founded Hirosawa Lineage of Tomitsu (Shingon sect's esoteric teaching) and established Henshoji Temple along the shore of Hirosawa-no-ike Pond. Ningai and Kancho are thought to have been successors in practical training and contrasted with Shobo. However, it should be interpreted that Shobo as well as Hirosawa school and Yakushin made important foundations in Shingon jisaho bunryu, which was later called Yataku Sanjuiroku-ryu.

sen.j: 聖宝は如意輪観音・准胝観音の両観音を尊崇して上醍醐笠取山上に祭祀し、朱雀天皇・村上天皇両帝の誕生を祈ったことが記録される。
sen.e: It was recorded that Shobo admired Nyoirin Kannon and Juntei Kannon, ran rites and festivals for them at Kami Daigo Kasatori-yama Mountain, prayed for the births of the Emperors Suzaku and Murakami.

It was recorded that Shobo admired both Nyoirin Kannon (the Bodhisattva of Compassion) and Juntei Kannon, ran rites and festivals for them at Mt. Kasatori, also known as Kami Daigo, and prayed for the births of the Emperors Suzaku and Murakami.

sen.j: 同時に如意輪観音には、空海が帰朝する際に付き従った清滝権現（清瀧権現）（せいりょうごんげん）の化身であるとの信仰が護持伝承されている。

sen.j: 正嫡には、弘法大師号を弟子淳祐 (僧)を伴い高野山奥の院に奉告し、空海後の真言宗団の組織興隆化を図った醍醐寺第一世座主観賢とする。

Kangen, the first zasu (head priest) of Daigo-ji Temple, was considered to be Shobo's legal child, who accompanied by Junyu, his disciple, dedicated Kobo Daishi-go title to Oku no in (inner sanctuary) on Mt. Koya, and intended for the prosperity of the post-Kukai Shingon organization.

sen.j: 聖宝を祖とする当山派修験道においては、一方で『修験恵印総漫拏羅』を通じて表現された不二一乗の世界観をもって大日如来による秘奥の説法を示すものとする。
sen.e: Tozan-ha (Shingon Sect) branch of Shugendo, in which Shobo is regarded as the founder, is thought to demonstrate profound preaching by Dainichi Nyorai with the sole perspective of the world, which was expressed through "Shugen keiin so mandara."
sen.cmt: 修験恵印総漫拏羅は、発音をローマ字表記しております。
sen.e: Tozan-ha (Shingon Sect) branch of Shugendo, for which Shobo is regarded as the founder, is thought to demonstrate profound preaching by Dainichi Nyorai with the sole perspective of the world, which was expressed through "Shugen keiin so mandara."

Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts) in Tozan School, which Shobo was founded, is thought to demonstrate profound preaching by Dainichi Nyorai with Funi Ichijo (most important of the Shingon principles which states to climb the mountain of Ichijo (truth), Mt. Omine, and pray for obtaining the body of funi (a thought that Ri (the innate reason) and Chi (knowledge) are non-two)), which was expressed through "Shugen Ein So Mandala" (literally, mandala of Shugendo under the teaching of Ein (Dainichi Nyorai's most secret teachings)).

sen.j: 一般に真言密教においては、金胎両部の曼荼羅を通じて、密教宇宙の理と智に係わるそれぞれの所謂『大（法身大日）・三（意密）・法（口密）・羯（身密）』パノラマで、或いは六大（体）・四曼（相）・三密（用）などの多元的な視点と、重重帝網（無碍）という統合的視点から大日如来の教えを展開／把握することが知られるが（即身成仏義）、聖宝においてはこの時代において理と智を一元論的な手法をオモテにして示していることは、修験道という日本的アニミスティック神霊信仰の点から注目される。
sen.e: Generally speaking, it is known that the preaching of Dainichi Nyorai should be developed and grasped both from pluralistic perspective, including Rokudai (tai), Shiman (so), Sanmitsu (yo), in the so-called "dai (hoshin dainichi), san (imitsu), hou (koumitsu), katsu (shinmitsu)" panorama, related with the reason and wisdom of Mikkyo univers and from integrative perspective of 重重帝網(無碍). It should be noted that Shobo exhibited reason and wisdom in a monastic way when he practiced in mountaineering asceticism, Japanese animistic belief in holy spirit.
sen.cmt: 『大（法身大日）・三（意密）・法（口密）・羯（身密）』六大（体）・四曼（相）・三密（用）重重帝網（無碍）は、英語表現がわかりませんでした。重重帝網（無碍）は、発音もわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Generally speaking, it is known that the preachings of Dainichi Nyorai should be developed and grasped both from a pluralistic perspective, including Rokudai (tai), Shiman (so), Sanmitsu (yo), in the so-called "dai (hoshin dainichi), san (imitsu), hou (koumitsu), katsu (shinmitsu)" panorama, related to the reason and wisdom of the Mikkyo universe and from the integrative perspective of 重重帝網(無碍). It should be noted that Shobo exhibited reason and wisdom in a monastic way when he practiced mountaineering asceticism, the Japanese animistic belief in holy spirit.

Generally speaking, it is known that the preaching of Dainichi Nyorai should be developed and grasped through both the vajra (the Diamond Realm) and garbha (the Womb Realm) mandalas, whether in so-called "dai (Great Mandala) (hoshin (Buddhism's highest form of existence) Dainichi), san (sanmaya mandala) (imitsu (mystery of mind)), ho (Buddhist Law Mandala) (kumitsu (esoteric speech)), katsu (katsuma mandala (action mandala)) (shinmitsu (bodily mystery))" panorama, which are related with Ri and Chi of Esoteric Buddhism world, or in both a pluralistic perspective including rokudai (six great elements; that is Dainichi Nyorai) (tai (body)), shiman (four mandala) (so (match)), sanmitsu (three mysteries) (yu (function)), and a general perspective of Juju taimo (unobstructed) (Sokushin Jobutsu gi), but in the viewpoint of mountaineering asceticism, the Japanese animistic belief in holy spirit, it should be noted that Shobo, at this time, exhibited the Ri and the Chi in a monastic way.

sen.j: これは平安後期の覚鑁興教大師以降、『金剛界／胎蔵界』という並立的表現方法が顕著となる以前の出来事であり、日本固有の信仰観について、後の応永の大成を頂点とする二而不二／不二而二に係わる各法匠の立場／背景、さらには日本の密教思想史、殊に事教二相を実践／検討する上で銘記するべき事象として理解することを求められよう。
sen.e: Shobo's idea had been shown before the parallel mode of expression, "Kongokai (Diamond Realm)/Taizokai (Womb Realm)," by Kakuban Kokyo Daishi became remarkable in the latter Heian period. His idea should be kept in mind in conducting/discussing the religious belief particular to the Japanese, each master's standpoint/background related with 二而不二/不二而二, in which Oeiki's great work reached the summit, and Japanese intellectual history of Mikkyo, especially 事教二相.
sen.cmt: 二而不二／不二而二、重重帝網（無碍）は、発音もわかりませんでした。
sen.e: Shobo's idea had been shown before the parallel mode of expression, "Kongokai (Diamond Realm)/Taizokai (Womb Realm)," by Kakuban Kokyo Daishi became remarkable in the latter Heian period. His idea should be kept in mind in conducting/discussing the religious beliefs particular to the Japanese, each master's standpoint/background related with 二而不二/不二而二, in which Oeiki's great work reached the summit, and Japanese intellectual history of Mikkyo, especially 事教二相.

This happened before the parallel mode of expression, "Kongokai (Diamond Realm) or Taizokai (Womb Realm)," became remarkable after Kakuban Kokyo Daishi in the latter Heian period, and should be understood as an epoch, regarding the religious beliefs particular to the Japanese, in conducting and discussing each master's standpoint or background related with Nini-Funi (also known as Funi-Nini (two sides of the same coin)) in which Oei no Taisei (Perfection in Oei era) reached the summit, more over in the Japanese intellectual history of Esoteric Buddhism, especially practicing or considering Jikyo niso (Jiso (method to practice the doctrine) and Kyoso (logical study of doctrines)).

sen.j: 聖宝が遺した『実修実証』の言葉は、当山派修行者の実践過程において、常に護持すべき修験道の心とする。
sen.e: The term, "Jishu jisho," left by Shobo, should be the mind of mountaineering asceticism and always maintained by practitioners of Tozan school in the process of practice.

sen.j: その実修根本となる『最勝恵印三昧耶法』（恵印灌頂）は、『理智不二界会礼讃』の具現化であり、正嫡の観賢だけでなく、大和鳥栖真言院鳳閣寺において貞崇に授けたと伝える。
sen.e: "Saisho Ein Sanma Yaho (Dainichi Nyorai's most secret teachings)Ein Kanjo (the ceremony to be the successor of a ritual of the Ein School)," which should be the base for practice, was the realization of "理智不二界会礼讃." It is said that it was given not only to Kangen, his direct disciple, but also to Teisu at Hokaku-ji Temple, Shingon-in, Yamato tosu.

"Saisho Ein Sanma Yaho" (Dainichi Nyorai's most secret teachings) (Ein Kanjo (the ceremony to be the successor of a ritual of the Ein School))," the base for practice, was the realization of "Richi funi Kai Kai Raisan" (worship of the Shingon conceptual world with the nonduality of knowledge and principle) and it is said that it was given not only to Kangen, his legal child, but also to Teisu at Hokaku-ji Temple, Shingonin, Yamato tosu.

sen.j: 当山派恵印法は、龍樹菩薩による霊異相承の伝から峰受法流とも呼ばれ、本山派峰中法流と対照されることがあるが、両派に共通する肝心は、実践第一を旨とし、世間の言語／思考に依るところの一切戯論を断絶して、山岳、或いは、人里の道場においても、ひたすら修行に打ち込むところにあると言える。
sen.e: Ein Ho of Tozan School is also called 峰受法流 because of Rei sojo (the initiation in a unseen and wondrous method) by Ryuju Bosatsu and is sometimes contrasted with 峰中法流 of Honzan School. It can be said that the main point common in both schools is to put the priority on practice; practitioners of austerity completely give up any meaningless discussion based on worldly words/thoughts; they only concentrate on practice in mountains or in training halls near which people live.

It can be said that the main point common in both schools is to put the priority on practice; practitioners of austerity completely give up any meaningless discussion based on worldly words/thoughts; they only concentrate on practice in mountains or in training halls near which people live.

Ein Ho (ritual) of Tozan School is also called Bujuho (practice on the mountain) School because of Rei sojo (initiation in an unseen and wondrous method) by Ryuju Bosatsu and is sometimes contrasted with Buchuho (practice on the mountains) School of Honzan School, however, it can be said that the main point common in both schools is to put the priority on practice; practitioners of austerity completely give up any meaningless discussion based on worldly words and thoughts; they only concentrate on practice in mountains or in training halls near which people live.

sen.j: このことは、神秘直感を通じて般若空の真理に直参せんとした大乗仏教中観派の法匠たる龍樹菩薩の教えを忠実にすることに通じるものである。
sen.e: This is connected with following the teaching of Ryuju Bosatsu, the master of Chukan school of Mahayana Buddhism, who tried to reach directly the truth of Hannyaku through mystic instinct.

sen.j: また理智不二礼讃によって明かされる清浄菩提心に向かう祈りの実践は、真言第三祖／龍猛ナーガルジュナの直系たることを自覚するものであり、同時に、全ては普門総徳大日如来から生み出される別徳諸仏諸菩薩の理趣を体得せんとして在る真言密教への篤信と確信に繋がるものである。
sen.e: The practice of prayer directed to pure bodhisattva's spiritual awakening which is opened by 理智不二礼讃 is done in order that the prayer recognizes that he/she is in a direct line of Shingon's third founder/ 龍猛ナーガルジュ; at the same time, the practice is connected to the belief in and assuarance of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, which exists so as that its believers try to realize rishu of 別徳諸仏諸菩薩, which are made from Fumon Sotoku Dainichi Nyorai (the Tathagata Mahavairocana).
sen.cmt: 理智不二礼讃発音もわかりませんでした。真言第三祖龍猛ナーガルジュ別徳諸仏諸菩薩についても、わかりませんでした。
sen.e: The practice of prayer directed to pure bodhisattva's spiritual awakening which is opened by 理智不二礼讃 is done in order that the prayer recognizes that he/she is in a direct line of Shingon's third founder/ 龍猛ナーガルジュ. At the same time, the practice is connected to the belief in and assuarance of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, which exists so as that its believers try to realize rishu of 別徳諸仏諸菩薩, which are made from Fumon Sotoku Dainichi Nyorai (the Tathagata Mahavairocana).

The practice of prayer directed to pure bodhisattva's spiritual awakening which is opened by Richi funi Raisan is done in order that the prayer recognizes that he or she is in a direct line of Shingon's third founder, Naagaarjuna (Ryuju), and at the same time, the practice is connected to the belief in and assurance of Shingon Esoteric Buddhism, which exists so as that its believers try to realize rishu (the Principle of the Perfection of Wisdom) of bettoku (Distinguished virtue) Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, which all are made from Dainichi Nyorai as Fumon Sotoku (all virtues of Universal Gateway).
